org.prime.core
Interface IPrimeApplication

All Known Implementing Classes:
PrimeApplication
public interface IPrimeApplication

This interface defines the set of operations provided by PRIME to Application under development. For benefiting from them, Application must extend the PrimeApplication Class

Author:
Mauro Caporuscio

Parameters:

setTmpPath

Sets the path to the Temporary folder

Parameters:
path - is the location where temporary resources will be stored.

setGateway

void setGateway(ICommGateway gateway)
Sets the Communication Gateway through which the PrimeApplication communicates

Parameters:
gateway - instance.

setHTTPServerParameters

void setHTTPServerParameters(java.lang.Integer maxThreads,
                             java.lang.Integer maxQueued)
Parameters:
maxThreads - (DEFAULT = 10) Maximum number of worker threads that can service calls. If this number is reached then additional calls are queued if the "maxQueued" value hasn't been reached.
maxQueued - (DEFAULT = 0) Maximum number of calls that can be queued if there aren't any worker thread available to service them. If the value is '0', then no queue is used and calls are rejected if no worker thread is immediately available. If the value is '-1', then an unbounded queue is used and calls are never rejected.

registerResource

CURI registerResource(Description desc,
                      java.lang.Class<? extends PrimeResource> resource)
Registers a new resource, identified by the given Description, into the DNS

Parameters:
desc - The resource Description.
resource - The Java class implementing the resource to be deployed.

registerResource

CURI registerResource(java.lang.Class<? extends PrimeResource> resource)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Registers a new resource into the DNS. Description is automatically retrieved from the Resource Repository (it must have the same file name of the Class resource given as input).

Parameters:
resource - The Java class implementing the resource to be deployed.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

lookup

java.util.Collection<LookupResult> lookup(AURI aURI,
                                          long timeout)
Interrogates the Prime DNS asking for the set of available resources implementing the given AURI

Parameters:
aURI - The Semantic concept to search for.
timeout - The timeout (expressed in milliseconds).
Returns:
A Java Collection of LookupResults. null if NO results

query

java.util.Collection<QueryResult> query(java.lang.String query,
                                        long timeout)
Interrogates the Prime DNS asking for the set of available resources matching the given SPARQL Query

Parameters:
query - The SPARQL Query.
timeout - The timeout (expressed in milliseconds).
Returns:
A Java Collection of QueryResults. null if NO results

observe

void observe(URI uri,
             NotificationHandler notificationHandler)
Declares the intent of Observing the given URI (either a cURI or aURI)

Parameters:
uri - The URI of interests.
notificationHandler - The Notifiable Object in charge to handle notifications.

unobserve

void unobserve(URI uri,
               NotificationHandler notificationHandler)
Stop observing the given URI (either a cURI or aURI)

Parameters:
uri - A NotificationHandler can be associated to many different URI at the same time. URI specifies the topic of interest to be removed. if uri is null NotificationHandler is removed from all topics.
notificationHandler - The NotificationHandler in charge to handle notifications.

notify

void notify(CURI from,
            URI subject,
            java.io.Serializable msg)
Notifies the observers by means of the provided message.

Parameters:
from - The CURI of the resource which is issuing the notification
subject - The URI of interest.
msg - The message to notify to all the observers.

initResourceRegistry

void initResourceRegistry(java.lang.String[] ontologies,
                          java.lang.String applicationNamespace)
Initializes the Knowledge

Parameters:
ontologies - The set of RDF ontology filenames needed for initializing the knowledge.
applicationNamespace - The NameSpace defined by this Prime Application

getHTTPConnection

Returns a HTTP connection towards the resource identified by target

Parameters:
target - the CURI of the target resource
Returns:

Returns a point-to-multipoint connection towards the resources belonging to group

Parameters:

the PrimeConnection object managing the connection
